1.text: And he spake to them a parable, that they must always pray, and not lose courage;

2.text: Saying, There was a certain judge in a certain city, fearing not God, and not occupied about man:

3.text: And a widow was in that city; and she came to him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.

4.text: And he would not for a time: and after these he said in himself, And if I fear not God, and am not occupied about man;

5.text: Yet because this widow produces fatigue to me, I will avenge her, lest in the end, coming, she give me a blow under the eyes.

6.text: And the Lord said, Hear ye what the judge of injustice says.

7.text: And shall not God do the avenging of his chosen, crying to him day and night, being slow to anger toward them?

8.text: I say to you, that he will do their avenging swiftly. But the Son of man having come, shall he find faith upon earth

9.text: And he spake to certain trusting upon themselves that they were just, and setting at nought the rest, this parable:

10.text: Two men went up to the temple to pray; one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

11.text: The Pharisee having stood, prayed these to himself, O God, I return thee thanks that I am not as the rest of men, rapacious, unjust, adulterers, or also as this publican.

12.text: I fast twice of the Sabbath; I pay tithes of all I possess.

13.text: And the publican, standing afar off, would not either lift up the eyes to heaven, but struck upon his breast, saying, God propitiate for me the sinful.

14.text: I say to you, this one went down to his house justified rather than that one: for every one lifting up himself shall be humbled; and he humbling himself shall be lifted up.

15.text: And they also brought babes to him, that he might touch them: and the disciples having seen, censured them.

16.text: And Jesus having called them, said, Leave the young children to come to me, and hinder them not: for of such is time kingdom of God.

17.text: Truly I say to you, Whoever should not receive the kingdom of God as a young child should not enter into it.

18.text: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Teacher, having done what, shall I inherit eternal life?

19.text: And Jesus said to him, Why sayest thou me good? none good except the one God.

20.text: Thou knowest the commands, Thou shouldest not commit adultery, Thou shouldest not kill, Thou shouldest not steal, Thou shouldest not bear false testimony, Honour thy father and thy mother.

21.text: And he said, All these have I watched from my youth.

22.text: And Jesus having heard these, said to him, Yet one thing fails thee: all whatever thou hast, sell and distribute to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.

23.text: And he having heard these things, was sorely grieved: for he was very rich.

24.text: And Jesus having seen him being sorely grieved, said, With how much difficulty shall they having possessions come into the kingdom of God!

25.text: For it is easier for a camel to come through the hole of a needle, than for a rich one to come into the kingdom of God.

26.text: And they having heard, said, And who can be saved?

27.text: And he said, The things impossible with men, are possible with God.

28.text: And Peter said, Behold, we have left all, and followed thee.

29.text: And he said to them, Truly I say to you, That there is none who has left home, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for sake of the kingdom of God,

30.text: Who should not receive many fold in this time, and in life coming, eternal life.

31.text: And taking the twelve, he said to them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things written by the prophets shall be completed to the Son of man.

32.text: For he shall be delivered to the nations, and be mocked, and insulted, and spit upon:

33.text: And having scourged, they shall kill him: and the third day he shall rise.

34.text: And they understood nothing of these things: and this word was hidden from them, and they discerned not the things spoken.

35.text: And it was in his drawing near to Jericho, a certain blind sat by the way, begging:

36.text: And having heard the multitude passing by, he inquired what this might be.

37.text: And they announced to him, That Jesus the Nazarite passes by.

38.text: And he cried out, saying, Jesus, son of David, pity me.

39.text: And they going before censured him, that he be silent: and he so much the more cried out, O son of David, pity me.

40.text: And Jesus having stood, commanded him to be brought to him: and he having drawn near, he asked him,

41.text: Saying, What wilt thou I shall do to thee? And he said, Lord, that I might see again.

42.text: And Jesus said to him, See again: thy faith has saved thee.

43.text: And he immediately saw again, and followed him, honouring God: and all the people having seen, gave praise to God.
